title: Century Egg Salad Recipe
full_text:
Century Egg Salad Recipe
Close
Jump to recipe
Prep
5 mins
Active
10 mins
Total
5 mins
Serves
2 servings
Cook Mode
(Keep screen awake)
Ingredients
2
preserved eggs
, peeled, rinsed, quartered lengthwise (see note)
2
tablespoons
vegetable oil
2
tablespoons
soy sauce
2
teaspoons
water
2
teaspoons
rice vinegar
2
teaspoons
sesame oil
1/4
teaspoon
salt
1/8
teaspoon
granulated sugar
1
medium
clove garlic
, sliced
1
red Thai chile
, sliced
1
scallion
, sliced
1/3
cup
chopped cilantro leaves
Directions
Arrange preserved eggs on a plate. In a medium bowl, whisk vegetable oil, soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, salt, sugar, and garlic. Pour over eggs and sprinkle with chile, scallion, and cilantro. Serve.
Notes
Preserved eggs (also known as century eggs or hundred-year-old eggs) can be found in the refrigerated section of most Chinese markets. Occasionally they can be found pasteurized and stored at room temperature.
